results.title: Wuthering Heights
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Samuel Goldwyn and William Wyler
results.brief_description: A passionate interpretation of Emily Bronte’s classic Victorian novel starring Laurence Olivier, Merle Oberon, David Niven, Donald Crisp, Flora Robson and Geraldine Fitzgerald.
results.description: A passionate interpretation of Emily Bronte’s classic Victorian novel starring Laurence Olivier, Merle Oberon, David Niven, Donald Crisp, Flora Robson and Geraldine Fitzgerald.

results.title: Wuthering Heights
results.creator_credit: Samuel Z Arkoff and Robert Fuest
results.brief_description: Based on Emily Bronte’s novel of defiant young lovers and set in the 18th Century amidst the harsh realities of the Yorkshire moors. This version is considered a good and realistic treatment of Bronte’s novel with authentic locations. Starring Timothy Dalton as Heathcliff and Anne Calder-Marshall as Cathy.

results.title: World of Apu = World of Apu
results.creator_credit: Satyajit Ray Production and Satyajit Ray
results.brief_description: The third in the Apu trilogy, the scene opens in Calcutta, where Apu, now a jobless ex-student, dreams of becoming a writer. Extracted from this insular environment, Apu’s life changes when he visits a village and exchanges himself for the mad bridegroom. After his wife’s death during childbirth, Apu leaves Calcutta. His life becomes one filled with indifference. Apu’s journey back to the world is painful but ultimately fulfilling. This is a moving film, considered to be one of Ray’s best, perhaps because the theme is so profound: that without death there cannot be life. The music by Ravi Shankar adds to the film’s power. Based on the text by Bibhutibhusan Banerji.

results.title: Women on the verge of a nervous breakdown = Mujeres al borde de un ataque nervios
results.creator_credit: Laurenfilm, El Deseo S. A. and Pedro Almodovar
results.brief_description: Pepa, an actress, is tough, sexy and desperate. Her longtime lover and male chauvinist rat, Ivan, to whom she is pregnant, has walked out leaving only a bland message on her answering machine. Pepa simply cannot resist fighting back and is determined to find Ivan. She decides to sublet her apartment. The first couple to look at the apartment are Carlos, Ivan’s 20 year old son, whom Pepa had never known about, and Marisa, Carlos’ uptight virgin fiancee. To make things even more delirious, Pepa’s best friend, Candella, comes looking for refuge from the police. Into this maelstrom of tension walks Lucia, Ivan’s ex-wife… A raucously funny depiction of melodramatic and crazy women who get their revenge any way they can. Stars Carmen Maura and Antonio Banderas. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Wombling free
results.creator_credit: Rank Organisation Film Productions, Ian Shand and Lionel Jeffries
results.brief_description: Based on the original Womble Books and characters created by Elizabeth Beresford and on the BBC television series designed by Ivor Wood and produced by Graham Clutterbuck, this feature length film brings those dear fat furry Wombles to life and into our hearts. Since Adam and Eve, the Wombles’ mission is to keep the world a tidy place, to pick up the mess that human beings leave behind and to try and make human beings listen to the message that they should not litter the environment or create pollution of any kind. “Wombling free” takes us to England and the home of the Wombles of Wimbledon Common where we meet Madame Cholet, the most famous Womble cook in the whole world, Tomsk and Bungo, fat, greedy and lazy Orinoco, Wellington, a clever inventor who lacks confidence and Great Uncle Bulgaria (who narrates the story). Only those who believe in the Wombles can see the Wombles and whilst attempting to get the human beings to listen to his message of anti-litter anti-pollution, Bungo makes friends with a young schoolgirl named Felicity “Kim” Frogmorton who helps Bungo in convincing other human beings, including her parents, that Wombles do indeed exist. There are plots and sub-plots but this delightful story is filled with magic, music, song and dance and lots of funny fat furry characters who manage to spread the serious message of caring for the environment in a light-hearted, easy to understand way. Cast includes David Tomlinson, Frances de la Tour, Bernard Spear, Yasuko Nagazumi and Bonnie Langford as Kim.

results.title: Woman of the Year
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joseph L Mankiewicz and George Stevens
results.brief_description: In this sophisticated comedy, the initial venture of that impeccable partnership of Katharine Hepburn and Spencer Tracy, Hepburn plays a renowned columnist and celebrated expert on world affairs. Tracy works on the same newspaper as a sports writer. When Hepburn is nominated “Woman of the Year”, the fight is on between career and marriage.

results.title: Woman of the dunes = Suna no onna
results.creator_credit: Teshigahara Productions, Kiichi Ichikawa, Tadashi Ono and Hiroshi Teshigahara
results.brief_description: Out in the sand dunes a woman lives alone at the bottom of a pit. One day the local villagers bring a man to her. He can’t escape; gradually the two are drawn to each other. Out of this bizarre, if simple situation, Teshigahara builds an atmospheric, highly charged and remarkably sensual exploration of the human condition.
results.title_for_label: Woman of the dunes = Suna no onna

results.title: Wolf
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Douglas Wick and Mike Nichols
results.brief_description: Publisher Will Randall - recently retrenched and replaced by younger, sycophant protegee Stewart (James Spader) - notices strange behaviour after a wolf at full moon bites him. The behaviour involves a heightening of the senses and rejuvinates his lagging demeanor, turning him into a younger version of himself. The metamorphosis reaches full flight at the next half moon when he takes a moonlit wander and awakes in the morning covered in blood and unaware of his actions. Medical science is unable to find an answer to his symptoms, however Dr Vijay Alezias (Om Puri) tells Will he is assuming the characteristics of a werewolf, the crucial point being that Randall can only change if he already possesses the animal instinct. He finds a sympathetic ear to his predicament from his former employer’s beautiful young daughter Laura (Michelle Pfeiffer), whom he is entrusted with protecting after Stewart joins him as a werewolf but doesn’t have the love of a good woman to quell his animal appetite. A hirsute love story, part comedy, part horror, the cast also includes Christopher Plummer, Prunella Scales, Kate Nelligan and David Hyde Pierce and features an impressive gothic mise-en-scene and evocation of the New York publishing scene.

results.title: Witness for the prosecution
results.creator_credit: Theme Pictures, Arthur Hornblow and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: Director Billy Wilder’s acclaimed 1957 courtroom melodrama based on Agatha Christie’s hit London play left audiences reeling from its surprise twists and shocking climax. Charles Laughton, Tyrone Power, Marlene Dietrich and Elsa Lanchester make this Oscar nominated classic a rivetiing experience. When a wealthy widow is found murdered, her married suitor, Leonard Vole (Power) is accused of the crime. At his trial, everyone is stunned when the prosecution calls Vole’s wife (Dietrich) to testify against him. Now it is more difficult than ever for Vole’s flamboyant defence attorney (Laughton) to prove that his client is innocent.

results.title: Witness [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Edward S. Feldman and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Peter Weir’s captivating American film debut is presented as a white knuckle mystery thriller, collision of cultures and a sensual romance. An Amish boy witnesses a drug-related murder and with his mother (Kelly McGillis) and a wounded cop (Harrison Ford), takes refuge in the sheltered Amish community. Violence comes to “peacelands” in a film of stark contrasts, delicate subtleties and surprising humour. Note how the widow blooms under the cop’s attentions. Ford has never been better, portraying a hero real enough to show fear when faced with both barrels of a shotgun. Cast includes Josef Sommer, Lukas Haas, Jan Rubes, Alexander Godunov, Patti Lupone, Danny Glover and Brent Jennings.
